item.title: [HADOOP-8599] Non empty response from FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations when asking for data beyond the end of file
item.description: When FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations(file,start,len) is called with "start" argument equal to the file size, the response is not empty. There is a test TestGetFileBlockLocations.testGetFileBlockLocations2 which uses randomly generated "start" and "len" arguments when calling FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations and the test fails randomly (when the generated start value equals to the file size).
item.summary: Non empty response from FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations when asking for data beyond the end of file

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

The patch fixes the condition of going beyond EOF in the FileSystem.getFileBlockLocations by changing 

    if (file.getLen() < start) {
      return new BlockLocation[0];

to 

    if (file.getLen() <= start) {
      return new BlockLocation[0];

An additional assert is added to the unit tests to verify the case.
